p: Despite the significant range and depth of factors impeding efforts to address climate change, research shows that planning and implementation of adaptation actions are taking place in many countries around the world (Aylett 2015). Where such progress is being made, available funding (Lemieux et al. 2015; Shi et al. 2015) and political and organizational leadership (Burch 2010; Measham et al. 2011; Nordgren et al. 2016) are commonly cited as key drivers, highlighting the fact that certain factors can either enable or impede adaptation. Other frequently cited factors enabling climate change adaptation include awareness of present or future climate change impacts (Tompkins et al. 2010; Shi et al. 2015) and collaboration and sharing of information between organizations and agencies (Juhola and Westerhoff 2011; Lemieux et al. 2015; Nordgren et al. 2016).
